intro: Plagiobothrys foliaceus, commonly known as the leafy plagiobothrys, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has a short stem with opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Plagiobothrys foliaceus is known for its ephemeral blooming period, which occurs in early spring.
